Models#

We provide the users numerous models implementation, ranging from a very simple logistic regression to a more complex Transformer-based model with exiting strategies. Most of the models are either direct papers implementation or code taken from a repository and rewritten into a more concise way.

If you feel like a model is missing and would be a great addition to the repository, please open an issue!

Lightning Models#

The following models are LightningModule wrapping up PyTorch models and defining the corresponding training logic.

class bert_squeeze.models.base_lt_module.BaseTransformerModule(training_config: DictConfig, num_labels: int, pretrained_model: str | None = None, **kwargs)[source]#

Base class to extend for all modules.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels

  • pretrained_model (str) – name of the pretrained Transformer model to use

class bert_squeeze.models.lr.BowLogisticRegression(vocab_size: int, num_labels: int, training_config: DictConfig, **kwargs)[source]#

Logistic Regression leveraging bag of n-grams representation of a text.

Parameters:

  • vocab_size (int) – size of the vocabulary used for the bag of n-grams representation

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels for the classification task

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration to use

class bert_squeeze.models.lstm.LtLSTM(training_config: DictConfig, vocab_size: int, hidden_dim: int, num_labels: int, *args, **kwargs)[source]#

Lightning module to train a LSTM-based model on a sequence classification task.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration to use

  • vocab_size (int) – size of the vocabulary used for the bag of n-grams representation

  • hidden_dim (int) – number of features in the hidden states

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels for the classification task

class bert_squeeze.models.lt_bert.LtCustomBert(training_config: DictConfig, num_labels: int, pretrained_model: str, **kwargs)[source]#

Lightning module to fine-tune a BERT based model on a sequence classification task.

Note: It uses a custom BERT model (see models.custom_transformers.bert.py) for explanation.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels for the classification tasks

  • pretrained_model (str) – name of the pretrained Transformer model to use

class bert_squeeze.models.lt_deebert.LtDeeBert(training_config: DictConfig, pretrained_model: str, num_labels: int, **kwargs)[source]#

Lightning module to fine-tune a DeeBert based model on a sequence classification task (see models.custom_transformers.deebert.py) for detailed explanation.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels

  • pretrained_model (str) – name of the pretrained Transformer model to use

class bert_squeeze.models.lt_distilbert.LtCustomDistilBert(training_config: DictConfig, pretrained_model: str, num_labels: int, **kwargs)[source]#

Lightning module to fine-tune a DistilBERT based model on a sequence classification task.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels

  • pretrained_model (str) – name of the pretrained Transformer model to use

class bert_squeeze.models.lt_fastbert.LtFastBert(training_config: DictConfig, num_labels: int, pretrained_model: str, **kwargs)[source]#

Lightning module to fine-tune a FastBert based model on a sequence classification task (see models.custom_transformers.fastbert.py) for detailed explanation.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels

  • pretrained_model (str) – name of the pretrained Transformer model to use

class bert_squeeze.models.lt_theseus_bert.LtTheseusBert(training_config: DictConfig, pretrained_model: str, num_labels: int, replacement_scheduler: DictConfig, **kwargs)[source]#

Lightning module to fine-tune a TheseusBert based model on a sequence classification task (see models.custom_transformers.theseus_bert.py) for detailed explanation.

Parameters:

  • training_config (DictConfig) – training configuration

  • num_labels (int) – number of labels

  • pretrained_model (str) – name of the pretrained Transformer model to use

  • replacement_scheduler (DictConfig) – configuration for the replacement scheduler

Custom Transformers#

The following models are PyTorch implementations of some specific Transformer-based models.

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.bert.BertCustomEncoder(config: PretrainedConfig, **kwargs)[source]#

Custom BERT encoder to enable layer dropping according to various techniques.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

get_layer_to_prune(dropping_technique: str, K: int) → List[bool][source]#

Implementation of various layer dropping strategies as presented in https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.03844.

Parameters:

  • dropping_technique (str) – dropping strategy to use to prune layers. The following strategies are available: - top: dropping the top K layers - bottom: dropping the bottom K layers - alternate: one layer is drop, the following is dropped, and so on. - symmetric: drops the K middle layers.

  • K (int) – number of layers to drop

Returns:

list of boolean indicating whether to drop layer i.

Return type:

List[bool]

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.bert.CustomBertModel(config: PretrainedConfig, add_pooling_layer: bool = True)[source]#

Custom BERT model using BertCustomEncoder to perform layer dropping.

Parameters:

  • config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture.

  • add_pooling_layer (bool) – whether to add a pooling layer on top of the model.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

classmethod from_config(config: PretrainedConfig, **kwargs)[source]#

Create a CustomBertModel object from a given config.

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.deebert.DeeBertEncoder(config: PretrainedConfig)[source]#

We construct the DeeBertEncoder as a regular BertEncoder except that we squeeze an OffRamp (a classification layer) between each BertLayer.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

init_highway_pooler(pooler: ModuleDict) → None[source]#

Initialize the pooling layer of each ramp based on a given pooling layer.

Parameters:

pooler (torch.nn.ModuleDict) – holds modules in a dictionary.

set_early_exit_entropy(x: List[float] | float) → None[source]#

Assigning an entropy threshold to every layer.

Parameters:

x (Union[List[float], float]) – entropy threshold to assign to the layer, can either be a float that will be set to all layers or a list of different thresholds to set to individual layers.

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.deebert.DeeBertModel(config: PretrainedConfig)[source]#

Bare DeeBert model without head on top, outputting hidden states.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

get_input_embeddings() → Tensor[source]#

Returns the model’s input embeddings.

Returns:

A torch module mapping vocabulary to hidden states.

Return type:

nn.Module

init_highway_pooler() → None[source]#

Initializes the pooler layer from each ramp of the encoder with its current pooler layer

set_input_embeddings(value) → None[source]#

Set model’s input embeddings.

Parameters:

value (nn.Module) – A module mapping vocabulary to hidden states.

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.deebert.OffRamp(config: PretrainedConfig)[source]#

Classification layers (referred to as off-ramps) in the paper.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(hidden_states: Tensor) → RampOutput[source]#
Parameters:

hidden_states (torch.Tensor) – output of the previous transformer layer.

Returns:

output of the given off-ramp containing both the classification logits and the pooled outputs.

Return type:

RampOutput

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.fastbert.FastBertClassifier(config: PretrainedConfig)[source]#

This module is a “branch”, also defined as student classifier in the paper, that mimics the teacher’s architecture. A FastBertClassifier layer is squeezed between each Transformer block to enable early outputs in simple cases.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.fastbert.FastBertGraph(config: PretrainedConfig)[source]#

Implementation of the FastBERT model presented by in “FastBERT: a Self-distilling BERT with Adaptive Inference Time” https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.02178.

FastBERT enables the user to adapt the inference speed by avoiding redundant calculations. This is achieved by squeezing student classifier within every Transformer block of the backbone.

The training procedure is done in two stage. First the backbone as well as the final classifier are fine-tuned while the student classifiers are kept frozen. In the second stage the model’s knowledge is self-distilled to the student classifiers which predictions are compared to the soft-labeled teacher outputs.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a BERT model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(embeddings: Tensor, attention_mask: Tensor, device: str, inference: bool = False, inference_speed: float = 0.5, training_stage: int = 1) → Tuple[Tensor, int] | List[Tensor][source]#
Parameters:

  • embeddings (torch.Tensor) – embeddings constructed from word, position and token_type.

  • attention_mask (torch.Tensor) – tells the model which tokens in the input_ids are words and which are padding. 1 indicates a token and 0 indicates padding.

  • device (str) – device to move the tensors to.

  • inference (bool) – whether the model is inference mode. If yes, after each student layer we compute the uncertainty and feeds it to the next layer until enough information is has been collected.

  • inference_speed (float) – threshold to distinguish high and low uncertainty. The higher the inference_speed the faster and less accurate the model is.

  • training_stage (training_stage) – current training stage. If equals to 0, fine-tuning both the major backbone and the teacher classifier, while the student layers are frozen. If equals to 1 the backbone is frozen and only the student layers are fine-tuned.

Returns:

at inference time the model returns

the predicted logits along with the index of the exit layer. At training time the model returns a list containing the predicted logits of all the exit layers.

Return type:

Union[Tuple[torch.Tensor, int], List[torch.Tensor]]

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.theseus_bert.TheseusBertEncoder(config: PretrainedConfig, nb_successor_layers: int = 6)[source]#

Implementation of the TheseusBert encoder presented in the paper: “BERT-of-Theseus: Compressing BERT by Progressive Module Replacing” (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2002.02925.pdf).

The general idea behind is to be able to compress the original BERT model by dividing it into submodules which will be substituted by a compressed version (aka “successor_layers”).

Parameters:

  • config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture.

  • nb_successor_layers (int) – total number of layers in the compressed model.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(hidden_states: Tensor, attention_mask: Tensor | None = None, head_mask: Tensor | None = None, encoder_hidden_states: Tensor | None = None, encoder_attention_mask: Tensor | None = None) → BaseModelOutputWithPastAndCrossAttentions[source]#

During the training for every successor layer we sample the Bernoulli distribution and replace the original layer with its corresponding successor layer with probability replacing_rate and keep the original with probability 1 - replacing_rate.

At inference time all the original layers are replaced by their successor layers.

Parameters:

  • hidden_states –

  • attention_mask –

  • head_mask –

  • encoder_hidden_states –

  • encoder_attention_mask –

Returns:

init_successor_layers() → None[source]#

Creates the successor layers by copying layers from the original model.

set_replacing_rate(replacing_rate: float) → None[source]#

Sets the probability to use in the Bernoulli distribution which will later be used to compute the model’s outputs.

Parameters:

replacing_rate (float) – probability to use in the Bernoulli distribution

class bert_squeeze.models.custom_transformers.theseus_bert.TheseusBertModel(config: PretrainedConfig)[source]#

Implementation of the TheseusBert presented in the paper: “BERT-of-Theseus: Compressing BERT by Progressive Module Replacing” (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2002.02925.pdf).

The implementation is similar to the transformers.BertModel one except that it uses the previously defined TheseusBertEncoder as encoder.

Parameters:

config (PretrainedConfig) – Configuration to use to instantiate a model according to the specified arguments, defining the model architecture.

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

Model Layers#

The following sub-package contains implementation of multiple layers that can be reused across different model architectures.

class bert_squeeze.models.layers.classifier.Classifier(config)[source]#

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

class bert_squeeze.models.layers.mha.MultiHeadedAttention(hidden_size, heads_num, dropout)[source]#

Each head is a self-attention operation. self-attention refers to https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.03762.pdf

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(key, value, query, mask)[source]#
Parameters:

  • key – [batch_size x seq_length x hidden_size]

  • value – [batch_size x seq_length x hidden_size]

  • query – [batch_size x seq_length x hidden_size]

  • mask – [batch_size x 1 x seq_length x seq_length]

Returns:

[batch_size x seq_length x hidden_size]

Return type:

output
